justification: Interviewee states that family and friends became interested in the diet after seeing health changes in the interviewee, showing direct support.

stance_1: I experienced health benefits from eating mostly meat
justification: Interviewee states following a ketogenic diet (primarily meat) led to health benefits, forming a direct supportive link.

stance_1: I experienced health benefits from eating mostly meat

justification: Success in achieving health benefits motivates planning further elimination and reintegration diets to optimize health outcomes.

stance_1: I experienced health benefits from eating mostly meat

justification: Health improvements drive the desire to monitor bodily reactions to foods, supporting ongoing dietary experimentation.

stance_2: I plan elimination and reintegration diets

stance_2: Running out of meat-based foods leads to cheat meals
justification: Adherence to ketogenic diet is challenged when meat-based foods are unavailable, resulting in cheat meals; this is explicitly described.
